item.title: Asian Stocks Set for Boost After US Tech Rebound: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian stocks are set for a positive open after a rebound in big tech drove US stocks higher. Bonds fell as the dollar hit its lowest since 2023.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

item.title: Byron Allen Hires Moelis to Shop $1B in Local Stations
item.description: Producer and host Byron Allen has hired Moelis & Co. to find buyers for 28 local TV stations his company owns, in an effort to reduce debt while taking advantage of potential deregulation in the broadcast business. Chris Palmeri has more on “Bloomberg The Close.”

item.title: CFO Turnover Hits Record in 1Q
item.description: In the first quarter of the year we've seen 95 changes in CFO positions up from 89 during the prior-year period. Bloomberg's Nina Trentmann has the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Team Pushes for Xi Call as Trade Tensions Simmer
item.description: US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping are likely to speak this week, the White House said, as the world’s two largest economies remain locked in trade turmoil. “I can confirm that the two leaders will likely talk this week,” White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt told reporters on Monday. She did not provide a date for what she said was a “potential” call nor guarantee one would occur. The Chinese Embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Washington and Beijing have traded accusations that each has violated the terms of last month’s broad agreement that saw both sides reduce tariffs from astronomical highs. The barbs have threatened to undo the fragile truce, which would provoke fresh worries for global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dow Jones, S&P 500, Nasdaq All Up | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Scarlet Fu, Tim Stenovec, Emily Graffeo. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: EchoStar Bond Woes Grow as Dish Network Interest Payment Skipped
item.description: EchoStar Corp., the wireless and pay-TV operator controlled by billionaire Charlie Ergen, has decided to skip interest payments on three bonds after a similar act late last week.
item.dc:creator: Dorothy Ma

media:content.media:description: A Dish satellite dish receiver on the roof of a home in Wrightwood, California, US, on Monday, Sept. 30, 2024. DirecTV and Dish have agreed to combine in a deal that will create the biggest pay-TV provider in the US with about 18 million subscribers. Photographer: Kyle Grillot/Bloomberg

item.title: Michael Saylor’s Strategy Offers $250 Million in Preferred Stock
item.description: Strategy is planning to list a new type of perpetual preferred stock, as the company led by Michael Saylor seeks to raise more funds to buy Bitcoin.
item.dc:creator: Gowri Gurumurthy, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Michael Saylor speaks during the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, on May 29.

item.title: Growth of Interval ETFs; SEC Concerned on Crypto ETF Staking | ETF IQ 6/2/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg ETF IQ" focuses on the opportunities, risks and current trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. Today's guests: Strategas ETF Strategist Todd Sohn, Hoya Capital CIO David Auerbach, and Bloomberg's Isabelle Lee. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Alberta Wildfires Shut About 7% of Canada’s Oil Production
item.description: Wildfires in Canada’s energy heartland of Alberta have shut down almost 350,000 barrels of daily heavy crude production — about 7% of the country’s output — as a major blaze near the province’s eastern border menaces oil sands operations.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

media:content.media:description: Wildfire smoke above Highway 97 near Trutch, British Columbia, on May 30.

item.title: SEC Concerned on Crypto ETFs Offering Staking Rewards
item.description: A potentially watershed effort to launch US crypto exchange-traded funds that offer staking rewards is throwing up regulatory doubts, even after the funds said they received initial SEC registration approval. Bloomberg's Isabelle Lee has the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Auerbach on Hoya Capital High Dividend Yield ETF (REIT)
item.description: Hoya Capital CIO David Auerbach discusses the Hoya Capital High Dividend Yield ETF (ticker: RIET). He speaks with Scarlet Fu, Katie Greifeld and Eric Balchunas on “ETF IQ.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wall Street Sees Deeper Rout as Dollar Nears 2023 Low
item.description: Wall Street banks are reinforcing their calls that the dollar will weaken further, hit by interest-rate cuts, slowing economic growth and President Donald Trump’s trade and tax policies.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Carson, Aline Oyamada, Anya Andrianova

item.title: Mark Dowding Sees Long Bonds at 6%
item.description: RBC Global Asset Management Bluebay Chief Investment Officer Mark Dowding sees long bonds at 6% and believes the yield curve will need to steepen. He speaks with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk Taps Investors for Billions Days After Leaving Trump’s Side
item.description: Elon Musk is selling $5 billion in debt for his artificial intelligence startup, xAI Corp., the latest in a series of fundraising efforts across his business empire as the billionaire pivots away from politics and returns to running his various companies.
item.dc:creator: Jeannine Amodeo, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: The xAI logo in New York. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: BWH Hotel CEO on Pricing, Brand Loyalty, Labor
item.description: BWH Hotels President and CEO Larry Cuculic discusses pricing, loyalty programs and labor market in an interview with Scarlet Fu on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US Aluminum and Steel Prices Surge as Trump Doubles Tariffs
item.description: Futures tracking aluminum and steel prices in the US surged after President Donald Trump said he will double tariffs on the metals this week.
item.dc:creator: Mark Burton

item.title: Bremmer on Trump's Trade War and His Negotiating Style
item.description: Ian Bremmer, Eurasia Group president and founder, talks about how President Donald Trump is trying to reach trade deals with different countries, American exceptionalism and how Trump is handling issues with China. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Stocks Extend May’s Gains as Hopes About Trade Deals Resurface
item.description: US equities closed higher Monday, extending the strong gains of May, as technology and energy shares rose, helping to reverse early losses in the session that were spurred by worries around trade friction and signs of economic weakness.
item.dc:creator: Esha Dey

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Tech Fuels New York Economic Growth
item.description: Julie Samuels, president and CEO of Tech:NYC, explains what makes New York stand out as a home for startups and tech development. She joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Gets Late-Day Boost as Bonds, Dollar Fall: Markets Wrap
item.description: A rebound in big tech drove stocks higher after a slide driven by weak manufacturing, trade and geopolitical risks. Bonds fell as the dollar hit its lowest since 2023.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Strategas ETF Strategist Sohn ono Interval Funds
item.description: Strategas ETF Strategist Todd Sohn discusses interval funds in an interview with Eric Balchunas, Scarlet Fu and Katie Greifeld on “ETF IQ.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Treasuries Extend May Slump as Tariff Concerns Cloud Outlook
item.description: Treasuries began June on the back foot with 30-year bond yields testing the 5% level as concerns over President Donald Trump’s tariff policies resurfaced at the start of a data-heavy week for assessing the health of the world’s largest economy.
item.dc:creator: James Hirai, Michael Mackenzie

item.title: Tesla Under Pressure as Musk Renews His Focus
item.description: Dan Ives, managing director at WedBush, says Tesla and its CEO Elon Musk have been underestimated. Ives discusses why autonomous and robotics will allow it to overcome recent sales setbacks with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Asia’s Top-Rated Bonds Lifted by Pullback From US Treasuries
item.description: Bonds in Australia and Singapore are getting a lift from rising questions about the appeal of Treasuries, as fears that a proposed US tax bill may hit foreign investors add to pressure following a recent ratings downgrade.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Burgess, Marcus Wong, Miaojung Lin

item.title: Biggest Concern Is Return of Concentration Risk: Sohn
item.description: Strategas ETF Strategist Todd Sohn discusses what flows say about market sentiment. He speaks with Eric Balchunas, Scarlet Fu and Katie Greifeld on “ETF IQ.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Samsung and Perplexity Near AI Deal
item.description: Samsung is close to reaching a wide-ranging deal to invest in Perplexity AI and put search technology from the artificial intelligence startup onto its devices. Bloomberg’s Seth Fiegerman discusses the plans with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Software Remains the Missing Ingredient in US IPO Rebound
item.description: May’s string of successful technology company debuts is reigniting optimism that the once-prolific enterprise software sector will soon resurface as a significant contributor to the US deal mix.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: The Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, US, on Tuesday, April 22, 2025. US stocks pared gains as traders weighed earlier remarks from Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on the US-China tariff standoff.

item.title: AI Demand Still Ravenous: CFRA's Zino
item.description: Angelo Zino, VP and senior equity analyst at CFRA, says investors who aren’t in AI and semiconductor stocks should buy, as Nvidia and Broadcom show strong sales demand. Zino joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump to Double Steel, Aluminum Tariffs to 50% | Bloomberg Markets 6/2/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests; RBC Global Asset Management Bluebay Chief Investment Officer Mark Dowding, BWH Hotels President CEO Larry Cuculic, and Bloomberg's Joe Deaux. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: ‘Glass Is Broken’ on Rare Earth Trade: Garnault’s Tobin
item.description: Liza Tobin, Garnault Global managing director, says China has "broken the glass" when it comes to restricting the sale of rare earth minerals to the US. Tobin discusses the rising trade tensions impacting tech with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)
